task: Predict neutron flux distribution in reactor core simulations for safety analysis
recommendation:
**Recommendation: neutron_flux_predictor_nn (v2)**

The neural network model should be promoted to Production for the neutron flux prediction task.

**Justification:**
- Achieves the best accuracy across all metrics: RMSE 0.0198 (15.4% better than XGBoost, 51.9% better than linear), MAE 0.0156, and R2 0.9521
- For safety-critical reactor simulations, prediction accuracy is the primary concern — the 15% improvement in RMSE over XGBoost is significant
- R2 of 0.9521 indicates the model explains 95.2% of variance in neutron flux distributions

**Acceptance Criteria Met:**
- R2 > 0.90 threshold: YES (0.9521)
- RMSE < 0.03 threshold: YES (0.0198)
- Inference latency < 100ms: YES (45.2ms)

**Risks/Considerations:**
- Inference latency (45.2ms) is 3.6x higher than XGBoost (12.4ms). For batch simulation runs this is acceptable, but if real-time monitoring is needed, consider the XGBoost model as a fallback
- The neural network has more parameters (4 hidden layers, 256 units) — monitor for overfitting on edge cases in reactor configurations not well-represented in training data
- Recommend A/B testing against the current production linear model for 2 weeks before full cutover
- Set up drift detection with 2 standard deviation threshold on input feature distributions
